Title: Archive: Sugar Pearl Vaccine and Tacet Discord Outbreak
Text:
Abstract:

NovaFei is an acute infectious disease with no effective treatment, primarily affecting children under six years old. It is highly contagious with severe symptoms including fever, limb pain, and muscle atrophy. To combat this disease, a live attenuated vaccine has been developed and successfully passed phase III clinical trials on June 16 at 3:00 p.m. . The Medical Section established a specialized team for this vaccine's development. This review aims to analyze the progress of the vaccine research and provide valuable insights for further studies. Results have shown promising immunization outcomes, making this vaccine a potential solution for preventing NovaFei infection.

1. Preliminary application of a neutralizing antibody detection method for NovaFei pseudovirus
2. Efficacy of live attenuated vaccine against NovaFei pseudovirus via injection
3. Clinical trial report of oral administration of "Sugar Pearl" live attenuated vaccine against NovaFei pseudovirus

Message from Section Member: Mrs. Xiangli... Is it really okay?
Response: Someone has to test it. I'm willing to test it on myself... and my son.

Related Report Entries:
NovaFei Fever Cases Surpass 2,000 with Death Toll Rising in April;
Huaxu Academy Forms Vaccine Research Group Under P.I. Xiangli's Leadership;
Jinzhou TD Outbreak Paralyzes Transportation and Medical Supply Distribution

Title: Oral NovaFei Fever Vaccine, Live Attenuated Mass Production Quality Standards and Transportation Overview of "Sugar Pearl"
Reporting Officer: Medical Officer III, Huaxu Academy
Report No.: MD-E0510

Abstract:

This report details the importance of delivering Huanglong's medical supplies to Jinzhou, which served as the front line of defense against TD Outbreak. The Midnight Rangers valiantly defended the city from the fierce outbreak, but due to transportation line blockages, the second-generation Sugar Pearl vaccine - known for its stability and suitability for children - faced challenges in reaching the city. This report outlines the quality standards for mass production and transportation of the vaccine and other medical supplies during the war, with a focus on ensuring their efficacy and safety. The innovative use of the more stable second-generation vaccine played a crucial role in protecting the citizens of Jinzhou from TD Outbreak, making it a valuable contribution to the battle against this deadly disease.

1. Quality Standards for Mass Production of Vaccines
2. Management Guidelines for Storage and Transportation of Vaccines
3. Assessment of Current Vaccine Transportation Methods

The transportation of the second-generation Sugar Pearl vaccine is a critical step in combating the TD Outbreak. In response to the challenges posed by interrupted main transportation routes and the treacherous terrain, a thorough plan was implemented. Refrigerated trucks equipped with temperature-monitoring equipment were used, accompanied by professional technicians to ensure proper storage and transport conditions. Additionally, due to the severity of the epidemic and the time sensitivity of vaccine delivery, medical supplies were divided into seven teams for transportation. The assistance of Resonator counterparts was vital in navigating through difficult terrain and potential Tacet Fields. As of August 5, only one team successfully arrived within the vaccine expiration date, thanks to the efforts of an unknown Resonator who escorted us and eliminated the TDs.

...

Attachment 2: Resonance Report of Resonator Involved in Vaccine Transport

Comment from Researcher #31:

Concerning the test report... The Resonator that accompanied the supplies through a fierce battle displayed astounding stability in its waveform. This data is truly remarkable; however, I can't shake the feeling that I've seen it before. Yet, there are no registered Resonators in our database with similar characteristics. What could this mean?

Another Comment from Researcher #31:

After some searching, I discovered that the data closely resembles the "First Resonator" I came across earlier. However, since we didn't have standardized resonance test reports at that time, it was not included in our current database. I have duly noted and placed it in the pending section for further investigation.

(P.S. Due to health reasons, my supervisor has advised me to take medical leave. As a result, I have entrusted this matter to Section 34, and they will complete the handover tomorrow.)

Comment from Researcher #34:

The report doesn't seem right. It mentions a person who existed during the founding of our state, but the time span is too long for it to be the same person in both reports. Perhaps this character is from history? I'll wait until the 31st to recover and then inquire about this potential mistake. He's worked three consecutive nights without rest. For now, I'll keep this report with me.
Source: Archive: Sugar Pearl Vaccine and Tacet Discord Outbreak
